chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Trunail Dantray Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant's probation is revoked. No further action taken.  Review hearing of 11/20/2015 is vacated.
cab
CORRECTION: Plea entry reflects corrected count numbers.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 3, and any other sentence with credit for 128 DAYS time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1, and any other sentence, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION  - *To be serviced by DOC MENTAL HEALTH UNIT OF PROBATION.

-Serve 60 DAYS (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Individual Therapy.
-No contact with Stephanie B., unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 4
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Counts 2 & 4 Dismissed, But Read In for sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED & COUNT 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. 
AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, Domesitc Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 813.12(8)(a), 973.055(1), an unclassifed Misdemeanor.

Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown  NOT in court, in custody, with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Final Pretrial Conference.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter, and requested a Plea & Sentencing date. Court VACATED jury Trial date of 6/29/2015. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Trunail Dantray Brown not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with STEPHANIE B., HER RESIDENCE, AND THE 4800 BLOCK OF N. 58TH ST., MILWAUKEE, WI
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
